: : Lunekill/DeathStar : :

Lunekill watched Dread go down, and the cloaking start.

Lunekill: What the?

Just then DeathStar finished collecting data.

DeathStar: Dread, are you ok? We can pull back!


Nic <Proudwing500k@...> wrote:
The huge winged beast fell to the ground after being hit once again.
Dreadplague transformed in her cloaked robot mode and went under the 
cover of a low rocky formation, barely able to fit there.

Something was happening. She seemed to make the shadow move around 
her. What was going on?

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : Lunekill : :
> 
> Lunekill clenched her optics tight, hsaking her head. She could 
feel the emotion penetrating her mental circuits. This one had 
telepathic abilities. With an effor, Lunekill locked out her head 
from Dread and reconcentrated her fire.
> 
> Lunekill: Well that was interesting. Not many Cybertronians have 
that power...
> 
> 
> Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> Dreadplague was hit bad, but she tried to soak as much as she 
could. 
> She had to give Deathstar the time to collect data. She had to 
fight 
> back.
> 
> Focus as hard as she could, she sent total terror into Lunekill. 
She 
> was not sure the other was going to fall prey to it, but she had to 
> try.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> > : : Lunekill/DeathStar : :
> > 
> > DeathStar took a scanner from subspace and started to collect the 
> data on these minions.
> > 
> > Lunekill was quite annoyed by the shrieking sound and extended 
her 
> other arm. Now energy bolts were coming from both hands, shooting 
at 
> Dreadplague. Some of the shots missed, striking and destroying a 
> mountain in the distance.(OOC: DBZ style)
> > 
> > 
> > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Dreaplague, hearing Deathstar's warning, transformed to her Fell 
> > Beast mode and made her way over the shot. That was not supposed 
to 
> > happen. They were not even in range to be discovered yet, as they 
> > were still in relative radar cover.
> > 
> > Dreadplague: Deathstar! Get the data! I'll distract them!
> > 
> > She tried to get Lunekill's attention by shrieking as harshly as 
> she 
> > could. 
> > 
> > Rockseeker, stayed behind. He was still worn out from the surge, 
> but 
> > he observed.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > : : DeathStar/Lunekill : :
> > > 
> > > DeathStar is quite happy to learn that Dreadplague wishes to 
> become 
> > his student.
> > > 
> > > DeathStar: It would be an honor...
> > > 
> > > Then DeathStar comes into visual contact with the Minions.
> > > 
> > > DeathStar: Well, Dread, there is the source of those signals. 
Do 
> > you want to observe them or introduce ourselves?
> > > 
> > > Lunekill was about to fly off when she caught sight of the 
> incoming 
> > Tripredacus.
> > > 
> > > Lunekill: Curiosity killed the Cybertronians.
> > > 
> > > Lunekill extends her arm, her long, claw like finger tips 
> glowing. 
> > She unleases several unknown energy blasts at Dreadplague and 
> > DeathStar.
> > > 
> > > Lunekill: DIE YOU PATHETIC VERMON!!!!!!!!!!
> > > 
> > > DeathStar sees the incoming shots.
> > > 
> > > DeathStar: Dread, evasive!
> > > 
> > > The star fighter barral rolls out of the way...
> > > 
> > > DeathStar: DeathStar, TRANSFORM!
> > > 
> > > Now in bot mode, DeathStar was ready to defend himself but 
their 
> > orders were not to engage the enemy under any circumstances.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > Rockseeker: Yes, Prime's heirs... Let's just hope no one 
figured 
> us 
> > > out and called for reinforcements yets. Ladies first.
> > > 
> > > He indicated the south with his hand, ready to follow his 
sister 
> as 
> > > soon as she moved.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> > wrote:
> > > > : : Lunekill : :
> > > > 
> > > > Lunekill: We start with the ones that would most likely cause 
> > > master the most trouble. The Maximals!
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > Rockseeker: According to my first pass over the planet, there 
> are 
> > > > three major installations on this planet. The first two are 
on 
> > the 
> > > > same continent, but a third one is on the southern continent. 
> > Where 
> > > > do we start, General?
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
<roborick007@y...> 
> > > wrote:
> > > > > : : Lunekill : :
> > > > > 
> > > > > Lunekill was reading her brothers thoughts.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Lunekill: Lucky for us, it's not on this planet. It has 
been 
> > lost 
> > > > since the recent revolution on Cybertron.
> > > > > 
> > > > > She closes her optics, summoning her drones to Earth.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Lunekill: They will be here soon. We can begin...
> > > > > 
> > > > > 
> > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Rockseeker remained silent for a while. That dreaded thing 
> had 
> > to 
> > > > be 
> > > > > found and destroyed!
> > > > > 
> > > > > Rockseeker: Shall we start, then? And shouldn't your summon 
> > your 
> > > > > drones?
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > > : : Lunekill : :
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Lunekill: We shall to be sure, but these beings are only 
a 
> > > threat 
> > > > > to him when they have that... object...
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > She remained illusive on the subject, but she knew her 
> > brother 
> > > > > would be clear on what she was talking about.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > Rockseeker dusted himself and looked at his sister.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Rockseeker: Do not forget, we must kill them to the last. 
> > > > > Otherwise, 
> > > > > > Master might suffer from it... or even more...
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> > <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > : : Lunekill : :
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Lunekill looked disgusted at the thought of the 
worthless 
> > > > > lifeforms.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Lunekill: Cybertronian transformers, bleh. We'll take 
> care 
> > of 
> > > > > them 
> > > > > > the same way we do all lower beings... total anihalation!
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > Rockseeker, was not so happy to see her, but a least, 
she 
> > had 
> > > > > > helped 
> > > > > > > him out. When she asked, however, why she was helping 
> him, 
> > he 
> > > > > began 
> > > > > > > to feel embarassed, and grudgingly decided to tell her 
> what 
> > > had 
> > > > > > > happened.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Rockseeker: I went into an Energon surge and attacked 
> those 
> > > > pesky 
> > > > > > > Cybertronians. Yes, even I can surge! The Energon here 
is 
> > so 
> > > > > strong 
> > > > > > > that I lost all restraints. Master will like it... Now, 
> how 
> > > > > should 
> > > > > > we 
> > > > > > > rid ourselves of the ants?
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> > > <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > : : Lunekill : :
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Lunekill arrived on Earth and was soon at her 
brother's 
> > > side, 
> > > > > > > finding him buried under the rubble.
> > > > > > > > Lunekill: Hahaha, caught between a rock and a hard 
> place.
> > > > > > > >  
> > > > > > > > She starts to move the boulders off him.
> > > > > > > >  
> > > > > > > > Lunekill: Remind me why I'm helping you...
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > OOC: Rockseeker's is a meteor.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > BIC:
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Rockseeker: Don't think I really wish to see you, 
> sister. 
> > I 
> > > > > only 
> > > > > > > did 
> > > > > > > > so because our Master told me he'd send you to get 
rid 
> of 
> > > the 
> > > > > > > > Cybertronians. Now hurry up and get here!
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> > > > <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > > : : Lunekill : :
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > From somewhere in the vastness of space, a 
telepathic 
> > > > signal 
> > > > > is 
> > > > > > > > transmitted. It reaches Rockseeker on Earth, through 
> the 
> > > > > barrier 
> > > > > > of 
> > > > > > > > linear time.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > *It has been along time since you have contacted me 
> > > > brother. 
> > > > > I 
> > > > > > > will 
> > > > > > > > come to aid you. Soon we will be together, to serve 
our 
> > > lord.*
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > OOC: I'm not sure of her alt mode and all right 
now. 
> > I'm 
> > > > > still 
> > > > > > > > working on the first sketch of her design. I'll 
> probably 
> > > make 
> > > > > > some 
> > > > > > > > changes and do another then come up with a final copy.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > Boulders had literally buried him. He was aching 
from 
> > the 
> > > > > > > injuries 
> > > > > > > > he 
> > > > > > > > > had suffered, but it was a good sign - he was still 
> > > online. 
> > > > > > > > However, 
> > > > > > > > > he was also depleted.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > He tried to push himself out of the rubbles, but 
> found 
> > > that 
> > > > > he 
> > > > > > > > could 
> > > > > > > > > not. He then resorted to doing what he didn't want 
> to; 
> > > > > calling 
> > > > > > > out 
> > > > > > > > to 
> > > > > > > > > his sister.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Rockseeker: Sister Lunekill, do you hear me? I'm 
> > trapped 
> > > > > under 
> > > > > > a 
> > > > > > > > pile 
> > > > > > > > > of rock. Care to lend a hand?

<DIV><STRONG>: : Lunekill/DeathStar : :</STRONG></DIV>
<P>Lunekill watched Dread go down, and the cloaking start.</P>
<P><STRONG>Lunekill: </STRONG>What the?</P>
<P>Just then DeathStar finished collecting data.</P>
<P><STRONG>DeathStar: </STRONG>Dread, are you ok? We can pull back!</P>
